item.title: Conducting Interviews: A Guide for the Inexperienced and a Refresher for the Seasoned
item.description: Bringing on new team members is an important and intricate process. It's a mutual discovery, one where finding the right fit for both parties is of utmost significance. To facilitate this exchange, there are three main areas to focus on during interviews: asking the right questions, creating room for candidates to ask their questions, and maintaining a high yet realistic bar throughout the hiring process.

item.title: Evaluating Decision Quality: An Exploration for Engineering Leaders
item.description: What if the success of your engineering projects didn't solely depend on the outcomes, but on the quality of decisions that led to those outcomes? Would you approach your decision-making process differently? In this exploratory article, we delve into the role of decision analysis and how engineering leaders can use it to drive innovative success and continuous learning.

item.title: Unlock Organizational Transformation with Consent-Based Decision-Making
item.description: Decisions are fundamental to any organization. They shape strategy, influence culture, and define our daily work. But who gets to make these decisions, and how? That's a question that's been the subject of much debate and experimentation, and the answer can have a profound impact on the success and culture of an organization.
